morebs2.ball_clump_data_generator module¶

class morebs2.ball_clump_data_generator.BallClumpDataGenerator(bounds, ballRadii, clusterInfo, filePath)¶

Bases: object

Parameters:

  • bounds (np.ndarray) – proper bounds array

  • ballRadii (iter) – sequence of ball radii required

  • clusterInfo (np.ndarray) – 2-tuple, [0] is sequence of i’th ball’s cluster radii ratios, and [1] is sequence of i’th ball’s density measures d, each cluster will have d points

  • filePath (str) – save filepath

static load_data_by_frame(frame, fp)¶
make_data()¶

Constructs the dataset by popping one random element in one random ball until all Balls are empty.

save_frame()¶

saves instance’s data in the form of a list with the variables – rbounds, ball centers, ball radius, cluster centers, cluster radii, cluster densities

set_frame()¶

Constructs a sequence of balls, and assigns points to them based on clusterInfo.

NOTE: points that may exist in multiple balls will be assigned to only one ball.

morebs2.ball_comp_components.intersection_ratio(b1, b2)¶

Calculates the intersection ratios of b1 and b2. The intersection ratio of a ball is the proportion of its diameter that lies in the intersection.

Returns:

intersection ratio of b1, intersection ratio of b2

Return type:

(float,float)|(None,None)

static ball_points_to_another(b1, b2, b2Radius, deleteFromB1)¶

Transfers each point p from .`b1` to b2 if p falls w/in distance of b2Radius. If deleteFromB1 is set to True, delete p from .`b1` if b2 accepts p.

morebs2.numerical_space_data_generator module¶

class morebs2.numerical_space_data_generator.NSDataInstructions(bInf, rm, filePath, modeia, noiseRange=None, writeOutMode='literal')¶

Bases: object

Data structure that uses ResplattingSearchSpaceIterator to generate data.

If arg<noiseRange> != None, then add noise to each point value. Generates data into file according to instructions given by arguments.

Parameters:

  • bInf – (bounds, startPoint, columnOrder, SSIHop, additionalUpdateArgs)

  • rm – (mode := relevance zoom | prg | sequence::(relevant points), RCH)

  • filePath – str

  • noiseRange (np.ndarray) – n x 2

  • writeOutMode – “literal” to write out every point iterated, “relevant” to write out only points deemed relevant by RCH

morebs2.point_sorter module¶

class morebs2.point_sorter.PointSorter(data)¶

Bases: object

class can be used by one of these ways: (1) instantiate class w/ vector of data, and sort data using method<sort_it>, (2) instantiate class w/ empty vector, call method<insert_point> to add to data. The sorted vector point data will be variable<newData>.

morebs2.relevance_functions module¶

morebs2.relevance_functions.RCHF__ISPoly(x: float, largs)¶

constructs a class<RChainHead> function that has as its first function a polynomial function represented by class<ISPoly> over float x. The remaining nodes of the class<RChainHead> instance are constructed by the sequence of arguments largs to produce a class<RChainHead> with 1+ nodes.

Parameters:

  • x (float) – value that single-variable polynomial applies over

  • largs – sequence of kwargs used by method<RChainHead.make_node>.

morebs2.relevance_functions.RCHF___in_bounds(bounds0)¶

non-referential class<RChainHead> instance that

morebs2.relevance_functions.RCHF__point_distance_to_references_dec(r, ed0, passString)¶
morebs2.relevance_functions.RCHF__point_in_bounds(b)¶
morebs2.relevance_functions.RCHF__point_in_bounds_subvector_selector(b)¶
class morebs2.relevance_functions.RCInst¶

Bases: object

class that acts as a node-like structure and a function, node is designed to be used w/ the capabilities:

  1. referential data (from outside of chain)

  2. (standard operator,operand)

This class is a function on a vector v that works by one of the four paths:

  1. deciding path with reference : cf(dm(rf,v),dt).

  2. deciding path w/o reference: cf(v,dt).

  3. non-deciding path w/ reference: cf(dm(rf,v)).

  4. non-deciding path w/o reference: cf(v).

Deciding paths require a none-null threshold value dt.

In addition to these capabilities,

Attribute rf:

reference value, as argument to dm(v,rf)

Attribute dm:

function f(v,rf)

Attribute cf:

function f(v,*dt), examples include operator.lt, operator.le, lambda_floatin, np.cross

Attribute dt:

value, use in the case of decision

branch_at(n, i)¶
inst_update_var()¶

updates each variable in self.updatePath.

load_path()¶

instantiates the main function self.f by one of the four specifications in the description for this class

load_update_info(updateInfo)¶
load_var_cf(cf)¶
load_var_dm(dm)¶
Parameters:

dm – function on (rf,v)

load_var_dt(dt)¶

loads a new deciding threshold value dt; used as cf(v,dt)

load_var_ref(rf)¶
mod_cf(dcf)¶
output_type()¶
path_type()¶
set_reference_data(rf, dm)¶
updateFunc¶

key is one of rf, dt; value is update function for that variable

updateInfo¶

list of values used in accordance with update function in self.updateFunc by indices specified in self.updatePath

updatePath¶

key is one of rf, dt; value is list of indices corresponding to values in self.updateInfo

update_var(k, v)¶

updates one of the class attributes rf, dm, cf,or dt with value v.

Parameters:

  • k (str) – attribute name

  • v – new update value

class morebs2.relevance_functions.RChainHead(verbose=False)¶

Bases: object

RChainHead is a sequence of functions with each element a node-like structure represented by RCInst.

Attribute s:

the chain of class<RCInst> instances.

Attribute vpath:

the sequence of transformation values that a value v goes through at each node in s.

Parameters:

  • updatePath (dict) – a dictionary of the key-value form node index -> sequence of indices in arg<varList>.

  • verbose (bool) – for print-display at each class<RCInst> transformation.

add_node_at(kwargz, index=-1)¶
apply(v)¶

main function of RChainHead; applies the composite function (full function path) onto v

Parameters:

v – argument into chain function

cross_check()¶
link_rch(rch, linkerFunc, prev=False)¶
load_cf_(rci, cfq)¶
load_update_path(up)¶

loads a self.updatePath

Parameters:

updatePath – update information (see )

load_update_vars(varList)¶
Parameters:

varList – tuple of update-variables

make_node(kwargz)¶

instantiates an RCInst node using the argument sequence kwargz. Note: selectorIndices refer to values in vpath.

Parameters:

kwargz (iterable) –

If index 0 is r (node uses reference values), then format is (r,rf,dm|(dm,selector indices),cf|(cf,selectorIndices),?dt?). If index 0 is nr (node does use reference values), then format is (nr,cf|(cf,selectorIndices),?dt?).

Please see the description for RCInst for details on these values.

merge()¶
update_rch()¶

Updates variables of each node class<RCInst>.

  • example:

class<ResplattingSearchSpaceIterator> calls this method on its class<RChainHead> instance after iterating through one pertinent bound.

morebs2.relevance_functions.hops_to_coverage_points__standard(k, h)¶

arguments: - k := - h := hop value of SSI

return: - matrix, dim (m,k), m the required number of points

class morebs2.rssi.ResplattingSearchSpaceIterator(bounds, startPoint, columnOrder=None, SSIHop=7, resplattingMode=('relevance zoom', None), additionalUpdateArgs=())¶

Bases: object

class<ResplattingSearchSpaceIterator> is a data-structure that relies on class<SearchSpaceIterator>. There are two modes for this class when it resplats on the original bounds: - “relevance zoom”: requires an RChainHead to determine relevance of each point - “prg”: pseudo-random generator of points in relevant bounds

Parameters:

  • bounds (np.ndarray, n x 2 matrix) – all generated points lie in this matrix

  • startPoint (np.ndarray) – n-point

  • columnOrder (iterable) – order by which the columns of the reference value carry over values.

  • SSIHop (int) – partition for each column of bounds

  • resplattingMode (("relevance zoom"|"prg",class<RChainHead>)) – determines how the data structure will generate new values after iterating through the previous bounds and collecting relevant bounds.

  • additionalUpdateArgs (tuple) – additional arguments used to update class<RChainHead> when updating class<ResplattingInstructor>

check_duplicate_range(d)¶

checks if range d is already present in self.rangeHistory.

Return type:

bool

static column_order(k, mode='random')¶

Outputs an ordering for k columns based on mode, one of random, ascending, descending.

declare_new_ssi(bounds, startPoint)¶

Declares either a class<SearchSpaceIterator> or class<SkewedSearchSpaceIterator> instance for the given bounds.

Parameters:

  • bounds –

  • startPoint –

display_range_history()¶
fix_zero_size_activation_range(ar)¶

fixes the zero-size activation range ar; new activation range is ar[0], midpoint(ar[0],next(ar[0]))

Parameters:

ar (np.ndarray, proper bounds) – zero-size activation range

Returns:

a range r with r[0] equal to ar[0] that is not a zero-sized range

Return type:

np.ndarray, proper bounds

class morebs2.search_space_iterator.SearchSpaceIterator(bounds, startPoint, columnOrder, SSIHop=7, cycleOn=False, cycleIs=0)¶

Bases: object

iterator operates in a sequential/linear manner.

Parameters:

  • bounds –

  • startPoint –

  • columnOrder (vector<int>) – vector<column indices>, first is left head

  • SSIHop (int) – hop over total distance ratio for each increment

  • cycleOn (bool) – keep going after cycle?

  • cycleIs (bool) – which end is cycle?

class morebs2.violation_handler.ViolationHandler1(maxBalls, maxRadius)¶

Bases: object

ViolationHandler1 is initialized with a max balls and max radius argument. If BallComp uses this handler, then BallComp will terminate once either of the max conditions of this handler is reached.
